resources.string: Requires root or dhizuku, root recommended
You can set users limit in this dialog. Creating too much users may overflow your device memory.

App will hide itself after end of all operations. Requires Dhizuku permission or root.

\n

Important: if used without root, this option just hides app from launcher, but app remains visible in settings! This option is incompatible with device admin rights if used with dhizuku rights.

App will clear itself after ending of all operations. Requires Dhizuku permission or root.

\n

Important: app will remain installed on device! This option is incompatible with device admin rights if used with dhizuku rights.

App will clear it\'s data after end of all operations. After clearing app\'s data app can only hide itself (see \"Hide itself option\"). In contrast with \"Clear itself\" option, app\'s permissions will be left intact.
App will start to destroy your data when you enter duress password (NOT PIN-CODE) - the same password you use to unlock this app. Requires running accessibility service.
Do you want to install dhizuku?
You need to install dhizuku app and give it device owner rights
Device can\'t be booted in safe mode now
Device can be booted in safe mode now
User switcher status was not changed
UI for user switching was disabled too
User switch status was not changed
You can open users settings now
Safe boot is disabled. Do you really want to enable safe boot? Adversary may use safe boot to circumvent device protection offered by the app.

Safe boot is enabled. Do you really want to disable safe boot? Adversary may use safe boot to circumvent device protection offered by the app. Please use root or ADB for safe boot disabling instead of Dhizuku.
Multiuser UI is enabled. Do you want to disable?
Multiuser UI is disabled. Do you want to enable?

User switcher UI is enabled. Do you want to disable? It\'s recommended to disable UI for switching between users every time you don\'t need it, because otherwise adversary may use pull down settings menu to get list of your profiles from lockscreen.

User switcher UI is disabled. Do you want to enable? It\'s recommended to disable UI for switching between users every time you don\'t need it, because otherwise adversary may use pull down settings menu to get list of your profiles from lockscreen.

Switching user is prohibited. Do you want to allow and enable UI for switching between users? It\'s recommended to disable UI for switching between users every time you don\'t need it, because otherwise adversary may use pull down settings menu to get list of your profiles from lockscreen.\nImportant: use this method only if enabling user switcher UI option didn\'t work.

Switching user is allowed. Do you want to prohibit and disable UI for switching between users? It\'s recommended to disable UI for switching between users every time you don\'t need it, because otherwise adversary may use pull down settings menu to get list of your profiles from lockscreen.\nImportant: use this method only if disabling user switcher UI option didn\'t work.
This app requires accessibility service for various actions. Click \"ok\" and go to \"Installed Services>Android AntiForensic Tools\" if you want to enable/disable accessibility service.

After completion of all operations app will run TRIM command and tell the drive about all areas of data are no longer being used and therefore can be erased. Enabling this option may reduce the likelihood of deleted data recovery. Requires root rights or shizuku rights.<\p>\n

Important: its recommended to use this option with root privileges. If you use this option with Shizuku permission and you will activate some trigger in BFU (before first unlock) state of your device, trim will not run.
App will wipe all user\'s data or all data on device if called from main user. For wiping all device data (calling wipe from main user) with device admin rights Android 13 or below required.

App will destroy itself after ending of all operations. Requires root rights or Shizuku permission. 

\n

Warning: self-destruction may take several seconds to complete, avoid providing correct password to adversary too fast after trigger activation.<\strong><\p>\n

Important: its recommended to use this option with root privileges. If you use this option with Shizuku permission and you will activate some trigger in BFU (before first unlock) state of your device, self-destruction will be postponed until first device unlock and Shizuku service activation. In this case “hide app” option can help you by hiding app from launcher until it will be deleted by Shizuku.

App will start to destroy data when usb device or usb accessory connected. Connecting device to computer in charging only mode will be counted too. This option will protect you from attacks. Don\'t forget to disable this option if you want to connect any USB device without losing data! Requires running accessibility service.
After reaching maximum number of wrong password attempts (default: 5), app will start to destroy your data. Requires device admin rights.
Select number of wrong password attempts in row to start clearing the data. Enabling this option will protect device against bruteforce. Default number: 10
Setup max latency between clicks in one sequence of clicks (in milliseconds) for usual mode. Default: 1500ms.
Setup max latency between clicks in one sequence of clicks (in milliseconds) for root mode. Default: 500ms.
Setup number of power button clicks in row for launching data destruction
Destroy data on power button clicks?

If you activate this option, pressing the phone\'s power off button a certain number of times in a row will delete the data.

Requires accessibility service and root rights.

If you activate this option, pressing the phone\'s power off button a certain number of times in a row will delete the data.

Using this option without root rights is deprecated for good reason. Consider using \"run on volume button\" option if you can\'t grant root rights.

In legacy mode application counts not button clicks, but screen on/off state switches caused by those clicks. There\'s delay between click and screen state change, and additional clicks made during this delay will not be counted. That means that you should not click too fast, that\'s why default max delay between clicks for this mode is high. This method is prone to false positives and false negatives.

Requires accessibility service.
If you activate this option, the device will reboot on usb connection, thus entering BFU mode and making it more difficult to hack the device. Requires root or dhizuku.
Do you want to grant root rights?

App needs root rights to perform the most restricted operations - for example, uninstall itself silently.

\n

Warning: granting root rights make the data destruction much more stealthy, but unlocking the bootloader and rooting your device can make it less secure against attacks by advanced hackers. If you think that you may be targeted by ones or you don\'t really need stealthy data deletion, then don\'t grant root permissions to the app. If, however, you are only wary of having your device searched and in your situation an obvious deletion of data from your device could put you in danger, then grant the app root privileges and configure it to stealthily delete your data.
Visit your root manager to revoke root rights for this app

Do you want to allow screenshots for this app? If screenshots are allowed for the app, Android system can make automatic screenshots of this app (screenshots are used for displaying app preview in recent apps). These screenshots can be viewed by attacker with root access. Disabling screenshots can also be helpful against spyware.
You need to provide root or dhizuku rights to enable this function

Deprecated option, use \"set logs status\" option instead.\n

Do you want to disable logd service on device boot? It will prevent adversary from using logs data to get history of data destructive actions. Logd will be enabled on device reboot when you will disable this option or delete the app. Requires root rights.

Deprecated option, use \"set logs status\" option instead.\n

Do you want to disable logd service after starting deletion of your data? It will prevent adversary from using logs data to get history of data destructive actions. Logd will be enabled on device reboot. Requires root rights.
Are you sure you want to launch data destruction? App will destroy selected data (files, profiles, etc.) and run selected actions (start TRIM, stop logging and etc.)
Setup delay between locking phone\'s screen and rebooting. Phone reboot will move it in BFU and erase encryption keys from memory.

When locked, device will wait for some time for you to unlock it. If you will not unlock it, device will reboot. That will move device in BFU mode and remove encryption keys from memory, making your device safer.
Move device to BFU on lock
UI for switching users would be disabled automatically on your device on boot. It will prevent discovery of your profiles via pull-down settings menu.
UI for switching users would be disabled automatically on your device on screen lock. It will prevent discovery of your profiles via pull-down settings menu.
Requires root or dhizuku, accessibility service, Android 9+
You are using not test-only version of the app. It have the drawback that the self-destruct option is not compatible with administrator priveleges. It\'s recommended to install test-only version.
Ypu need to provide root rights to select this option
Destroy data on power button clicks? (legacy)
Setup number of volume button clicks in row for launching data destruction
Setup max latency between clicks in one sequence of clicks (in milliseconds) for volume button. Default: 500ms.
Destroy data on volume up button clicks?
If you activate this option, pressing the phone\'s volume up button a certain number of times in a row will delete the data. Requires accessibility service.
Destroy data on volume down button clicks?
If you activate this option, pressing the phone\'s volume down button a certain number of times in a row will delete the data. Requires accessibility service.
Logs are enabled, do you want to disable? It will prevent adversary from using logs data to get history of data destructive actions.
Logs are disabled, do you want to enable?
Developer seetings are enabled, do you want to hide them?
Developer settings are hidden, do you want to unhide them?

These settings will change the device settings in some way that can be noticed by adversary. This means that an attacker can start suspecting that you used Android AntiForensic Tools to change these settings. Therefore, for all settings in this section, except legacy and questionable, there are instructions on how to reproduce the same settings manually. It is recommended that you memorise them and tell them to an attacker if they question you.

• Enable developer settings following this instruction
• Open developer settings
• Find "Logger buffer sizes" option. Set it to "off".
• Find "Store logger data persistently on device" option. Set it to "off".

Please use root or ADB for safe boot disabling instead of Dhizuku.

• Download SDK Platform tools on your PC

• Unzip the archive

• On your mobile device, unlock developer settings

• Open the developer settings and allow debugging via USB

• Connect devices and allow USB debugging for your PC

• Open the command prompt and enter the command <path to platform-tools folder>/adb[.exe] shell settings put global safe_boot_disallowed 1.

• Get root rights

• Download terminal emulator, for example Termux.

• Open emulator and enter command "su"

• Then enter command "setprop fw.max_users <number of users>".

After reaching maximum number of wrong password attempts (default: 5), app will start to destroy your data. Requires accessibility service.\nImportant: this method may not work for custom ROMs and exotic device languages. Use method, requiring admin rights, if this doesn\'t work for you.
You need to grant admin rights to select this option
You need to start accessibility service to select this option
Do you want to install shizuku?
You need to install shizuku app and activate it. I recommend downloading pixincreate\\\'s fork, because self-activation works better in his version of the app.
Open shizuku app and revoke shizuku permissions manually
